page.title: 13INDUSTRY
page.content:
CHANGING FACE OF MEDWAY JOBS
Mr. Dickman's first job was coffin making. Horse drawn wagons were still in use. His father and maternal grandfather were in the Royal Marines. His father was sent to Chatham at the outbreak of the 2nd World War. Mr. Dickman joined the dockyard in 1955 as an apprentice engineer. He worked there for 27 years. He was made redundant at the age of 45 with a wife and 2 children to support. Most of his fellow workers found other jobs locally. Mr. Dickman has been a school caretaker for 2 years. He is shortly returning to machine-engineering but working with aircraft not ships. He is joining an aircraft firm whose business is expanding. We wish him well!
